text: The method for finding the steepness of stairs suggests a way to find the steepness of a line. A line drawn from the bottom step of a set of stairs to the top step touches each step at one point. The rise and the run of a step are the vertical and the horizontal changes, respectively, between two points on the line.
The steepness of the line is the ratio of rise (vertical change) to run (horizontal change) for this step. We call this ratio the rate of change or slope of the line.

text:
Unlike the steepness of stairs, the rate of change of a line can be negative. To determine the rate of change of a line, we need to consider the direction, or sign, of the vertical and horizontal changes (the slope of a line) from one point to another.

We will learn more about slopes of lines in the Grade 8 unit Thinking with Mathematical Models.
